urls.title: Environment Agency calls on builders to follow duty of care
urls.description: Construction firms urged to take responsibility for their waste to limit disruption to the environment.

tweets.text: At the start (early 90‚Äôs) I saw the intro of DoC. Customers took it seriously, audited waste streams, inspected permits and witnessed disposals. Then ‚Å¶@EnvAgency failed to enforce it for 30 years & producers failed to respect it. https://t.co/0NfEDn52d9

We‚Äôre looking forward to working closely with our partners to develop 25 innovative projects to respond to flooding across England.

The Flood and Coastal Resilience Innovation Programme will inform our approach to the climate crisis in the run-up to #COP26 and beyond. https://t.co/uLncFImWcY
Check out this latest video https://t.co/7ItU3DBPZR   introducing an exciting long-term project for the coastal frontage between #HurstSpit and #Lymington @newforestdc @NaturalEngland @JBAConsulting

@CMPG @HighwaysWMIDS @EnvAgency Ah don‚Äôt worry, what they charged the house owner to clear the rubbish will pay the fine :-) Personally I would have lined them up and have the Firearms Team get some live practise in..... or is that a bit OTT?

We are much safer outdoors as fresh air blows away #COVID19 particles.

A beautiful day‚òÄÔ∏è with great news on project delivery from the ever brilliant @EnvAgencySW @DCfieldteamsEA and our Electrical contractor 

All superlatives exhausted- new telemetry cabinet and sensor housings installed at #Mevagissey. Hope they had an ice cream! Thanks, top job! https://t.co/DMTIGHTOP6

It's vitally important we protect our rivers.
That's why we're creating new legal duties on water companies and government to reduce the amount of sewage discharged into our waterways.
Find out more: https://t.co/ofgpkeZ0eN https://t.co/RoiNLfCUMI

tweets.text: @pow_rebecca @Dunne4Ludlow @DefraGovUK There are regulations already in place to penalise sewage dumping (and run off from agribusiness). The problem is the @EnvAgency hardly ever enforce the rules, so water companies pollute with impunity. Rivers are cheap sewers for @WaterUK

At the start (early 90‚Äôs) I saw the intro of DoC. Customers took it seriously, audited waste streams, inspected permits and witnessed disposals. Then ‚Å¶@EnvAgency failed to enforce it for 30 years & producers failed to respect it. https://t.co/0NfEDn52d9

@SianieRoo @EnvAgency HOWEVER they have vastly underestimated the power of the people CLEARLY. I feel the time is up on whatever is happening here . @StinkStopthe is growing in support against this place daily and will be on their arse until a resolve is found üí™üèΩ #capitoff #byebyeredindustries üëãüèΩ

There are 18 flood alerts and 3 flood warnings across the North West affecting north #Lancashire and #Cumbria. Find information on preparing for #flooding, and how to sign up to @EnvAgencyNW flood warnings on our website here: https://t.co/68ddvfxgEm

#floodaware #floodrisk https://t.co/cPz4mDhiaZ

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @greenarteries @GeorgeMonbiot @defra @EnvAgency The @EnvAgency has the 2020 EDM numbers from the water companies. Not that they will publish them. I'm hoping that @sandralaville has submitted an EIR so that @guardianeco can publish the figures.

urls.title: Climate: UK could face water shortages if action is not taken to conserve supplies
urls.description: The Environment Agency says we don't have enough infrastructure to store water from wetter winters for the drier summers.

tweets.text: .@EnvAgency Complaining about risk of #water shortages by 2050 doesn‚Äôt cut it, when population has increased & no major investment in new & larger reservoirs in a great many years. https://t.co/1pYXN7jjHp https://t.co/i2hCOUCUD2

tweets.text: #Slough is in the news today, having been selected to become a "sponge city". One of 25 innovative new @EnvAgencySE projects, this flood defence system will see roads transformed with permeable surfaces that soak up surface water. Read more @BBCNews: https://t.co/YFu82y0TWy

We spent a long while working up the initial Keeping Ure Rivers Cool project with @yorkshire_dales @UniversityLeeds @WoodlandTrust @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE 
We love what has been achieved so far and hope we can continue this on into the future! 
#treeplanting #partnership https://t.co/WtLMpwMXGO

Plastic sludge is slowly killing an urban river in Hackney . But no officials will take responsibility so volunteers step in such as @julian_kirby and @hmug  https://t.co/9lqFudhqwd - happy to highlight as part of @gbspringclean @KeepBritainTidy

Example of WTT advice/project that can be supported by @EnvAgency  Fisheries Improvement Project funds, direct donations & @WildTroutTrust  Annual Auction in partnership with @DonCatchmentRT 
 https://t.co/f0EuYAEH0v via @DonCatchmentRT

It is time the UK had its own rewilding programme for eel in the UK depleted waters @EelGroup we are after support @RewildingB @BenGoldsmith @ScottishEPA @EnvAgency @WetlandsInt @Shoal_Org @WWTSlimbridge @WWFLeadWater @theriverstrust @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/2t9R4HEbqH
